Bacon Jam Dip

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the ultimate indulgence for bacon lovers: Bacon Jam Dip! This creamy, savory dip combines the rich flavors of cream cheese, sour cream, and of course, the star ingredient—bacon jam. Perfect for game days, parties, or a cozy night in, this dip is sure to satisfy your cravings and impress your guests. With just a few simple ingredients, including shredded cheddar cheese and fresh green onions, you can whip up a decadent dip that's bursting with flavor. Whether you're serving it with crackers, chips, or fresh veggies, this Bacon Jam Dip is a delightful treat that will have everyone coming back for more. Read on to discover how to make this easy, crowd-pleasing appetizer that will elevate any gathering!

Ingredients

cream cheese

Use softened cream cheese for easier mixing. If you're looking for a lighter option, consider using Neufchâtel cheese, which has a similar taste but lower fat content. You can also blend in a bit of Greek yogurt for added tanginess.

bacon jam

If you don't have bacon jam on hand, you can make a quick substitute by cooking diced bacon until crispy, then mixing it with caramelized onions, a touch of maple syrup, and a splash of vinegar. This will mimic the sweet and savory flavor of bacon jam.

sour cream

Sour cream adds creaminess and tang. If you're avoiding dairy, consider using a dairy-free sour cream or Greek yogurt. For a richer flavor, try using crème fraîche.

cheddar cheese

Use sharp cheddar for a bolder flavor, or mix in a combination of cheeses like Monterey Jack or pepper jack for added creaminess and spice. If you're looking for a healthier option, consider using a reduced-fat cheese.

green onions

Green onions add freshness and a mild onion flavor. You can substitute with finely chopped chives or shallots for a different taste. For a bolder flavor, try using red onions, but use them sparingly as they are stronger.

garlic powder

Garlic powder provides a concentrated garlic flavor. If you prefer fresh garlic, use one clove finely minced, but reduce the amount according to your taste preference. Roasted garlic can also be used for a sweeter, more mellow flavor.

salt

Season gradually, tasting as you go. If you're using bacon jam, be mindful that it may already contain salt. For a healthier alternative, consider using low-sodium salt or a salt substitute.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper enhances the flavor of the dip. For added complexity, consider using a mix of black, white, and pink peppercorns. You can also add a pinch of cayenne or smoked paprika for a kick.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Combine Cream Cheese, Sour Cream, and Bacon Jam

    In a mixing bowl, combine 8 oz of cream cheese, 1/2 cup of bacon jam, and 1/2 cup of sour cream. Use a hand mixer or a spatula to mix until the mixture is smooth and creamy. This step is crucial as it creates the base of your dip.

  • Step 2: Add Cheddar Cheese and Seasonings

    Next, incorporate 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese, 2 chopped green onions, 1 tsp of garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed. This adds flavor and texture to your dip.

  • Step 3: Transfer and Garnish

    Transfer the mixture to your serving dish. For an added touch, top with additional chopped green onions. This not only enhances the presentation but also adds a fresh flavor contrast.

  • Step 4: Serve and Enjoy

    Serve your bacon jam dip with an array of accompaniments such as crackers, chips, or fresh vegetables. This dip pairs well with a variety of snacks, making it perfect for parties or gatherings.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I soften cream cheese for the dip?

To soften cream cheese quickly, cut it into cubes and let it sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes. Alternatively, you can microwave it for 10-15 seconds in a microwave-safe bowl, but be careful not to melt it.

What is bacon jam and where can I find it?

Bacon jam is a sweet and savory spread made from bacon, sugar, and spices. You can find it in specialty stores or online, or you can make your own by cooking down bacon with caramelized onions and maple syrup.

Can I use different cheeses in this dip?

Absolutely! You can substitute the cheddar cheese with other cheeses like Monterey Jack, pepper jack for a kick, or even cream cheese for an extra creamy texture.

How should I chop green onions?

To chop green onions, first trim off the root end and any wilted tops. Then, slice the green part into thin rounds. You can use both the green and white parts in your dip.

What should I serve with this dip?

This dip pairs well with a variety of dippers! Consider serving it with crackers, tortilla chips, sliced baguette, or fresh vegetables like celery sticks and bell pepper strips.

How can I adjust the seasoning to my taste?

Start by adding a small amount of salt and pepper to the mixture, then taste and adjust as needed. Remember, you can always add more, but you can't take it out once it’s in!

How can I store leftovers?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. Make sure to cover it well to maintain freshness.

Can I make this dip ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the dip a day in advance. Just mix all the ingredients and store it in the refrigerator. Give it a good stir before serving.

What’s a good way to make this dip spicy?

To add some heat, consider mixing in diced jalapeños, a dash of hot sauce, or using spicy bacon jam if you can find it.

What kitchen tools will I need to make this dip?

You will need a mixing bowl, a spatula or spoon for mixing, a knife for chopping, and a serving dish to present your dip.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those with dietary restrictions, a dairy-free cream cheese and sour cream can be substituted to make the dip vegan-friendly. Ensure that the bacon jam used is also free from animal products if adhering to a vegan diet. Additionally, gluten-free crackers or vegetable sticks can be offered to accommodate gluten intolerance. This dip is inherently high in protein due to the cream cheese and bacon, making it a satisfying snack option.

Pairings

This Bacon Jam Dip pairs wonderfully with a variety of accompaniments. For a crunchy contrast, serve with an assortment of crackers, tortilla chips, or sliced baguette. Fresh vegetables such as carrot sticks, cucumber slices, or bell pepper strips also add a refreshing element. For a heartier option, consider serving alongside smoked meats like brisket or pulled pork. Beverage pairings include a crisp lager or a fruity IPA, which will complement the savory richness of the dip, as well as a dry white wine like Sauvignon Blanc that can cut through the creaminess.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Bacon Jam Dip in a rustic bowl or a cast-iron skillet for a warm, inviting presentation. You can garnish it with extra chopped green onions and a drizzle of bacon jam on top for visual appeal. For a themed gathering, consider themed serving options such as a charcuterie board that includes the dip alongside cured meats, cheeses, and pickled vegetables. For optimal enjoyment, serve the dip at room temperature to allow the flavors to meld beautifully and be easily spreadable. To elevate the experience, consider a side of homemade potato chips or pretzel crisps for a gourmet touch.

#

Bacon Jam Dip

25 min
$10
200 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 8

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Appetizer

Tags:

DipParty FoodAppetizer

Description

A savory, creamy dip with the rich taste of bacon and a hint of sweetness, perfect for parties or game days!

Ingredients

  • cream cheese: 8 oz
  • bacon jam: 1/2 cup
  • sour cream: 1/2 cup
  • cheddar cheese: 1 cup, shredded
  • green onions: 2, chopped
  • garlic powder: 1 tsp
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/22/2024
